english: gourd; calabash; bottle gourd; gourd-shaped object

etymology.interpretation: Names the bottle gourd and, by extension, gourd-shaped containers or objects; often seen in folk and Daoist contexts as a vessel for liquids or medicine. Also appears in idioms like 照葫芦画瓢 to mean copying by example.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 葫蘆 was simplified to 葫芦 by reducing 蘆 → 芦 (component 盧 → 卢 under the 1956 scheme); 葫 stayed the same.

examples.chinese: 桌上摆着一个葫芦(桌上擺著一個葫蘆)，装着自酿的酒(裝著自釀的酒)。
examples.pinyin: Zhuō shàng bǎizhe yí gè húlu, zhuāngzhe zìniàng de jiǔ.
examples.english: There is a gourd on the table holding homemade liquor.

examples.chinese: 道士腰间常挂葫芦(道士腰間常掛葫蘆)，用来装药酒(用來裝藥酒)。
examples.pinyin: Dàoshi yāojiān cháng guà húlu, yòng lái zhuāng yàojiǔ.
examples.english: Daoist priests often hang a gourd at the waist to carry medicinal wine.

examples.chinese: 他照葫芦画瓢(他照葫蘆畫瓢)，做了个差不多的模型(做了個差不多的模型)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhào húlu huà piáo, zuò le gè chàbuduō de móxíng.
examples.english: He copied the example and made a roughly similar model.
